Info

Defines class ATSLogger with attribute(s) and method(s). Creates an API for the ATS logging mechanism.

class ats_utilities.logging.ATSLogger(ats_name: str | None, ats_log_stdout: bool = True, ats_log_file: str | None = None, ats_logger_status: bool = False, verbose: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: ATSChecker

Defines class ATSLogger with attribute(s) and method(s). Creates an API for the ATS logging mechanism. ATS logger mechanism.

It defines:

attributes:
LOG_MSG_FORMAT - Log message format.
LOG_DATE_FORMAT - Log date format.
ATS_DEBUG - Debug log level.
ATS_WARNING - Warning log level.
ATS_CRITICAL - Critical log level.
ATS_ERROR - Error log level.
ATS_INFO - Info log level.
_verbose - Enable/Disable verbose option.
methods:
__init__ - Initials ATSLogger constructor.
write_log - Writes message to log file.
ATS_CRITICAL: int = 50¶
ATS_DEBUG: int = 10¶
ATS_ERROR: int = 40¶
ATS_INFO: int = 20¶
ATS_WARNING: int = 30¶
LOG_DATE_FORMAT: str = '%m/%d/%Y %I:%M:%S %p'¶
LOG_MSG_FORMAT: str = '%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s'¶
write_log(message: str | None, ctrl: int, verbose: bool = False) → bool[source]¶

Writes message to log file.

Parameters:

  • message (<Optional[str]>) – Log message for log file | None

  • ctrl (<int>) – Control flag (debug, warning, critical, errors, info)

  • verbose (<bool>) – Enable/Disable verbose option

Returns:

True (successfully logged message) | False

Return type:

<bool>

Exceptions:

ATSTypeError | ATSBadCallError
